fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.ovh

Class OvhOptionsBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.core.fluent.AbstractParent<OvhSmsBuilder>
      • fr.sii.ogham.sms.builder.ovh.OvhOptionsBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Builder<OvhOptions>, Parent<OvhSmsBuilder>

    public class OvhOptionsBuilder
extends AbstractParent<OvhSmsBuilder>
implements Builder<OvhOptions>
    Configures OVH SMS options:
    • Enable/disable the "STOP" indication at the end of the message (useful to disable for non-commercial SMS)
    • Define the SMS encoding (see SmsCoding): 1 for 7bit encoding, 2 for 16bit encoding (UTF-16). If you use UTF-16, your SMS will have a maximum size of 70 characters instead of 160. If null, automatic detection is used. Set the value to force a particular coding
    • Define a tag to mark sent messages (a 20 maximum character string)
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Constructor Detail

      • OvhOptionsBuilder

        public OvhOptionsBuilder(OvhSmsBuilder parent,
                         BuildContext buildContext)
        Initializes the builder with a parent builder. The parent builder is used when calling AbstractParent.and() method. The EnvironmentBuilder is used to evaluate properties when build() method is called.
        Parameters:
        parent - the parent builder
        buildContext - for registering instances and property evaluation

    • Method Detail

      • noStop

        public OvhOptionsBuilder noStop(Boolean noStop)
        Enable/disable "STOP" indication at the end of the message (useful to disable for non-commercial SMS).

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using noStop(). 

         .noStop(true)
 .noStop()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)
 
         .noStop(true)
 .noStop()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)
        In both cases, noStop(true) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        noStop - true to disable STOP message
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • noStop

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<OvhOptionsBuilder,Boolean> noStop()
        Enable/disable "STOP" indication at the end of the message (useful to disable for non-commercial SMS).

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .noStop()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)

        Non-null value set using noStop(Boolean) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .noStop(true)
 .noStop()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(false)
        The value true is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value

      • tag

        public OvhOptionsBuilder tag(String tag)
        Set a tag to mark sent messages (20 maximum character string).

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using tag(). 

         .tag("my-tag")
 .tag()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-tag")
 
         .tag("my-tag")
 .tag()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-tag")
        In both cases, tag("my-tag") is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        tag - tag name to use
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • tag

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<OvhOptionsBuilder,String> tag()
        Set a tag to mark sent messages (20 maximum character string).

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .tag()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-tag")

        Non-null value set using tag(String) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .tag("my-tag")
 .tag()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue("default-tag")
        The value "my-tag" is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value

      • smsCoding

        public OvhOptionsBuilder smsCoding(SmsCoding smsCoding)
        Set the message encoding:
        • "1" or "GSM7" for 7bit encoding
        • "2" or "UNICODE" for 16bit encoding
        If you use Unicode, your SMS will have a maximum size of 70 characters instead of 160.

        The value set using this method takes precedence over any property and default value configured using smsCoding(). 

         .smsCoding(SmsCoding.UNICODE)
 .smsCoding()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(SmsCoding.GSM7)
 
         .smsCoding(SmsCoding.UNICODE)
 .smsCoding()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(SmsCoding.GSM7)
        In both cases, smsCoding(SmsCoding.UNICODE) is used.

        If this method is called several times, only the last value is used.

        If null value is set, it is like not setting a value at all. The property/default value configuration is applied.

        Parameters:
        smsCoding - the coding for messages
        Returns:
        this instance for fluent chaining

      • smsCoding

        public ConfigurationValueBuilder<OvhOptionsBuilder,SmsCoding> smsCoding()
        Set the message encoding:
        • "1" or "GSM7" for 7bit encoding
        • "2" or "UNICODE" for 16bit encoding
        If you use Unicode, your SMS will have a maximum size of 70 characters instead of 160.

        This method is mainly used by Configurers to register some property keys and/or a default value. The aim is to let developer be able to externalize its configuration (using system properties, configuration file or anything else). If the developer doesn't configure any value for the registered properties, the default value is used (if set). 

         .smsCoding()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(SmsCoding.GSM7)

        Non-null value set using smsCoding(SmsCoding) takes precedence over property values and default value. 

         .smsCoding(SmsCoding.UNICODE)
 .smsCoding()
   .properties("${custom.property.high-priority}", "${custom.property.low-priority}")
   .defaultValue(SmsCoding.GSM7)
        The value SmsCoding.UNICODE is used regardless of the value of the properties and default value.

        See ConfigurationValueBuilder for more information.

        Returns:
        the builder to configure property keys/default value
